comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'm not 100% sure, but just going on a few pics and moving footage which can be tracked down on-line, I'd say the woman speaking is the English player Dorothy Round (1909-1982). She was Wimbledon Singles Champion in 1934 and 1937, and Australian Singles Champion in 1935. nla.gov.au/nla.news-article17113481 Here's another of Sam Hood's pics taken at the reception, also from the SLNSW collection - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=43184 In this pic, Fred Perry is sitting this side of Pat Hughes. Here's one of Sam Hood's fantastic action pics of Pat Hughes and Fred Perry, also from the SLNSW collection - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=51731

comment.author: 24647084@N00
comment._content: excuse me, but it does seem that the (emmm) "lady" sitting at the table is actually  a man in drag...

comment.author: 24647084@N00
comment._content: Seated at the far right of the table, is BERNADETTE BASSINGER (Terrance Stamp) of PRISCILLA QUEEN OF THE DESSERT who makes her first appearance at the Reception for the English Tennis Team.

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/addadada] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] According to our catalogue record, the lady speaking is indeed Dorothy Round. The other female player in the photo is recorded as Evelyn Dearman. Here's another photo of her from the UK National Portrait Gallery... www.npg.org.uk/collections/search/portraitLarge/mw131727/...
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Yes, Sam Hood's pic of Evelyn Dearman isn't exactly flattering...whereas the Bassano studios pic is really quite superb. Of course we also need to remember that she played in an era when tennis stars weren't required to have Hollywood looks as well!
